sub_topic: Probability of a certain type of technological failure occurring in a system
message_1: A certain type of technological system has a 5% chance of failure. If there are 20 of these systems in operation, what is the probability that at least one of them will fail?
message_2:
To find the probability that at least one of the 20 systems will fail, we can first find the probability that none of them will fail and then subtract that from 1.

The probability that a single system will not fail is 1 - 0.05 = 0.95.

The probability that all 20 systems will not fail is (0.95)^20 ≈ 0.3585.

Now, we can find the probability that at least one system will fail by subtracting the probability that none of them will fail from 1:

1 - 0.3585 ≈ 0.6415.

So, the probability that at least one of the 20 systems will fail is approximately 64.15%.
